attributes.action: Relieve John Bercow of his duties as speaker
attributes.additional_details: Such a move violates Bercow's convention on neutrality which he must respect as speaker. Likewise, it poses complications for British Foreign Policy. Therefore, this public petition calls for Parliament to issue a call of no confidence in Bercow and for him to be relieved of his duties immediately.
attributes.background: On 6th Feburary Speaker of the House of Commons John Bercow made an inappropriate intervention calling President of the United States Donald Trump a racist and a sexist and prohibiting him from speaking to Parliament in his upcoming visit.

rejection.details:
There is no mechanism for the removal of a Speaker during a Parliament. Other than at a general election, the Speaker can only stop being Speaker through resignation or death.

If you like, you could sign the petition below, which asks the House of Commons to debate a vote of no confidence in the Speaker:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/183279
